definitions.definition: the treatment of a physical problem or an illness
definitions.labels: (British English)(informal)(British English)(North American English)(British English)(British English)(British English)(British English)(North American English)(British English)(North American English)(British English)(British English)(British English)(North American English)(British English)(British English)

examples.text: Most leukaemia patients undergo some sort of **drug therapy** *(= treatment using drugs)*.
**alternative/complementary therapies** *(= treatments that do not use traditional drugs)*
They recommend exercise therapy for patients with chronic back pain.

definitions.definition: the treatment of problems with somebody's mental health by talking with them

examples.text: I went into therapy because my doctor suggested it.
the use of hypnosis as a form of therapy

wordOrigin: mid 19th cent.: from modern Latin therapia, from Greek therapeia ‘healing’, from therapeuein ‘minister to, treat medically’.
